name: Sergio da Silva
intro: My focus is on the front end.
about: A Brazilian with a major in Web Development, and minor in Graphic Design to better craft and build websites. Drawing is one of my favorite hobbies. Besides the HTML, CSS, and JS essential programming languages of web development, I also know how to write in Python and C++. I am a proactive learner and a good teacher. One example of that is that I learned how to speak English myself. I even started a free English class in my community, having almost 10 active students for 6 months before coming to Idaho. During COVID, I had a home-office internship at FamilySearch. I've created images, blog articles, translated videos, and live streamed for their social media. I also learned about Power BI there. I've created and weekly updated data models about all the FamilySearch Brazil Area reach using Power BI.

projects.name: Moonlander
projects.about: Simple game made using In this C++-based Moonlander game, players control a lunar module, maneuvering it to land safely on the moon's surface using basic thrust controls. With each level the terrain is randomly drawn, challenging players' precision and skill.

projects.name: List Sorter
projects.about: Among all the Python programs I have created, this one sticks out as one of the most interesting and useful ones. It is a simple sorter that promps for a .json file and display a list sorted alphabeticaly. You can also watch the video to see me testing it.

projects.name: Element Mixing App
projects.about: My first JavaScript project. The app have those four icons representing the four basic elements. You can click on two of them to see what thee mix would result in. For another test you need to refresh the page.

projects.name: Water Rafting
projects.about: My first experience building a full website. This website uses almost no JavaScript, so is more of a HTML and CSS only website

projects.name: Chamber of Commerce
projects.about: A ficticious chamber of commerce created by me aimed toward the Rexburd-Idaho population. Now JavaScript has used more and an API for weather was implemented.

projects.name: Inn & Suite
projects.about: A ficticious inn & suite company created by me aimed toward the people that wanted to visit Mormon Temples around the country. Again with JavaScript added and an API for weather implemented.

projects.name: Story Project
projects.about: A website containing a story I wrote. All the images contained in this website were also designed by me.

projects.name: FamilySearch Assets
projects.about: During my internship at FamilySearch I created more than 50 artworks that were used in the FamilySearch Brazil social media. At least 2 of them had a interaction spike, meaning that the likes and comments were way higher for the post that used them. I also participated in an event called RootsTech. I translated images to Portuguese, added captions to videos, and even recored my own tutorial. The video is added here

projects.name: Artwork Creations
projects.about: I draw both on paper and digitally. You can find some of my best creations in the Dropbox folder linked below

projects.name: Hardware Handling
projects.about: I have basic knowledge of hardware as well. From building my own pc to using Arduino and breadboards, I can make hardware work with little instruction. I linked a video of me showcasing an Arduino application I made.

testimonials.value: I am delighted to recommend Sergio da Silva, who has been a part of our online campus design team. Despite English not being his first language, Sergio's adaptability and quick learning were evident as he excelled in all communication tasks assigned to him, showcasing exceptional proficiency. Sergio was crucial in designing open educational resource textbooks for several classes. His creativity and attention to detail significantly enhanced the quality of these resources. Sergio's ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, including complex problems with campus page coding, was invaluable. One of Sergio's most commendable traits is his reliability and diligence. I highly recommend Sergio for any task or position he pursues. If you have any questions, please contact me. (PalmerJen@byui. edu | (208) 496 1898)
testimonials.name: Jennifer Palmer

testimonials.value: Sergio is a great communicator. I mentored him for one year during the BYU Pathway Worldwide program. His lessons were engaging and instructive. He made good use of humor to maintain the class engaged and we had a good time. On top of that, he is a good graphic designer, I say that based on the work I have seen so far.
